tweet:
So a few points about Vietnam….that most do not know.
1) supply chains for raw materials are still immature (read more expensive/ imported)

2) labor is limited and has very specific rules (it’s communist and small)

3) energy is less abundant 

4) ports and transport are slower

Then something happened in Vietnam.

A guy collapsed on the street.
Pulseless.
Type 1 diabetic.
Blood sugar tanked.

I gave CPR.
Managed him.
Stabilized him.

And the thrill I felt —
the meaning, the purpose, the rush

tweet:
Borders are not eternal.

What you call "southern China" today was once northern Vietnam.

Food
